title: Leveraging Recommender Systems to Reduce Content Gaps on Peer Production Platforms. (arXiv:2307.08669v2 [cs.CY] UPDATED)
abstract: Peer production platforms like Wikipedia commonly suffer from content gaps. Prior research suggests recommender systems can help solve this problem, by guiding editors towards underrepresented topics. However, it remains unclear whether this approach would result in less relevant recommendations, leading to reduced overall engagement with recommended items. To answer this question, we first conducted offline analyses (Study 1) on SuggestBot, a task-routing recommender system for Wikipedia, then did a three-month controlled experiment (Study 2). Our results show that presenting users with articles from underrepresented topics increased the proportion of work done on those articles without significantly reducing overall recommendation uptake. translated_title: 利用推荐系统缩小对等生产平台上的内容差距
translated_abstract: 维基百科等对等生产平台常常存在内容缺口。先前研究表明，推荐系统可以帮助解决这个问题，通过引导编辑人员关注被低估的主题。然而，目前尚不清楚这种方法是否会导致不太相关的推荐，从而降低对推荐内容的整体参与度。为了回答这个问题，我们首先在SuggestBot上进行了离线分析（研究1），然后进行了为期三个月的对照实验（研究2）。我们的结果显示，向用户展示来自被低估主题的文章可以增加在这些文章上的工作量，而不会明显降低对推荐内容的接受程度。我们讨论了结果的意义，包括如何忽视文章发现过程可能会人为地限制推荐。我们以"过滤气泡"的常见问题来展示这一现象，并对任何平台都存在的类似问题进行了类比。
tldr: 该研究通过在SuggestBot上进行离线分析和为期三个月的对照实验，发现推荐被低估主题的文章可以增加在这些文章上的编辑工作量，同时不会明显降低对推荐内容的接受程度。这一发现对解决对等生产平台上的内容缺口问题具有重要意义。
en_tdlr: By conducting offline analyses and a controlled experiment, this study found that recommending articles from underrepresented topics increases the editing work done on those articles without significantly reducing the acceptance of the recommendations. This finding is significant for addressing content gaps on peer production platforms.
